race.name: "ASL Run Series: 5K Walk/Run" ASL Deaf
race.description:
Registration is now open for the 175th Anniversary Run!

Proceeds will go to the Indiana School for the Deaf Alumni Association.

Time and Location

The run will be held at the Indiana School for the Deaf on last Saturday of September and time will starts at 9:30 a.m.

Race Prices

Your registration includes a large commemorative race medal and a towel. Please acknowledge that shirts are optional and not included with your registration. ** Registration must be paid by September 11th, to receive shirts.** The registration is non-refundable as this is a fundraising event for ISD. 


2019 ASL Run race on Sept. 28th: $25.00 before 8/30/19; $35.00 8/21/19 - 9/27/19; and $40.00 on race day.

2020 ASL Run race on Sept. 26th: $30.00 before 8/30/20; $40.00 8/31/20 - 9/27/20; and $45.00 on race day.

2021 ASL Run race on Sept. 25th: $35.00 before 8/30/21; $45.00 8/31/21 - 9/27/21; and $50.00 on race day.

Packets and Prizes

Packets can be picked up on the day of the race between 8:30 a.m. and 9:15 a.m. at the registration tent.

race.name: "Boots" for Troops 5K
race.description:
The Arnold Air Society John “Boots” Stratford squadron cordially invites you to participate as a sponsor
of the “Boots” for Troops 5k run/walk! This event is held in support of Hope for the Warriors: A
nonprofit organization that provides assistance to combat wounded veterans and their families.

race.name: "Build a Church" Missions 5K
race.description:
Grace Baptist Church is working with one of our missionaries to raise funds as they build a new church and Christian school in Liberia. The race will be held across from the church, starting at the Rails to Trails rest stop at Warm Springs Rd and 29th Street. Park at the church and walk on over to join the fun! To be guaranteed a shirt, you must register by January 31st! We have 3 options available:
5K (all ages!)
One-Mile Run for Adults
One-Mile Run for Kids (12 and under)

race.name: "Conquer The Canyon"  PA Grand Canyon 1/2 & Full Marathon + 5k
race.description:
Saturday & Sunday July 25th & 26th, 2020

Race Options & Start Times:

Saturday

  • Half Marathon (7am)
  • Full Marathon (7am)
  • 5k (7:30am)
  • 1 Mile (7:35am)

Sunday

  • Half Marathon (7am)

 

Challenges

  • 5K & Half
  • Full & Half
  • Half & Half
  •  

Fees:

Half marathon (Same Price for Saturday or Sunday)

  • $70 until 1/1/2020
  • $75 until 4/1/2020
  • $85 until race day (IF not sold out)  

Full Marathon

  • $85 until 1/1/2020
  • $95 until 4/1/2020
  • $105 until Race Day (IF not sold out)

5k

  • $30 until 4/1/2020
  • $35 until Race Day

Challenge First Option - 5k & Half

  • $85 until 1/1/2020
  • $95 until 4/1/2020
  • $105 until Race Day

Challenge Second Option - Full & Half

  • $125 until 1/1/2020
  • $135 until 4/1/2020
  • $145 until Race Day

Challenge Third Option - Half & Half

  • $120 until 1/1/2020
  • $125 until 4/1/2020
  • $135 until Race Day

1 Mile

  • $10
  •  

Courses:

5k & 1Mile will start @ the High School and will traverse the streets through Wellsboro finishing on the HS track!

The half and full courses will be run on State Park roads through Colton Point State Park. The first 2.4 miles will be a gradual climb with spots that level off. However, after that it's minimal elevation changes and a nice downhill finish! This course will feature AMAZING views of the Canyon and will be one of the MOST scenic & unique events you will run!

The marathon will be a BOSTON Qualifier!

Bib Pickup & Registration:

Registration will be open the morning of each race during the pick up times listed below – (unless sold out. There are caps on all the races, so don’t hesitate to sign up and secure your spot). See below for times/locations.

  • You may pick up your bib on race morning right near the Start/Finish line for all races.
  • You may also pick up your bib before and during the 5k/1mile at Wellsboro High School on Saturday the 25th starting at 6:00AM & concluding at 9:30AM for all races.
  • You may pick up your bib Saturday July 25th at a designated bib pickup (location/time is TBA).

Parking:

5k - Parking will be at Wellsboro High School. Wellsboro High School is located at 225 Nicholas Street, Wellsboro, PA.

Parking for the 1/2 & Full on Saturday July 25th & Sunday July 26th will be from the Tioga County Fairgrounds located at 2258 Charleston Rd, Wellsboro, PA 16901. There will be NO onsite parking for the half & full. There will be TWO shuttle companies that will be transporting runners and spectators to and from the half and full start/finish lines. Shuttles will run continuously starting at 5am!

Aid Stations:

There will be one station for the 5k with water and Gatorade.

There will be aid stations w/first aid, water and Gatorade approx every two miles for the half & full.

There will be paramedics on course for the half & full.

Awards:

Half & Full

Top 3 Male & Female

Top Masters Male & Female (40+)

There will also be age group awards for both male and female runners:

19 and under, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, 70+

5K

Top 3 Male & Female

Top Masters Male & Female (40+)

14 & under, 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, 70+

T-Shirts:

Amazing race themed short sleeve tech shirt

Finisher’s Medals:

Unique Medal Symbolic for the PA Grand Canyon will be awarded to all participants for the ½, full and 5k. Also, we will have a special additional medal for those that participant in any of the Conquer the Canyon Challenges! That means, if you participate in any of the Conquer the Canyon Challenges, you will be awarded THREE MEDALS!

Time Limit:

6 hours for both the 1/2 & full.

Average Temperature:

Low is 58 F and high is 78 F. The unique location lends to temperatures that will be mild compared to most areas in the summer.

Finish Line:

There will be a live DJ/Entertainer at the start/finish area throughout the half and full.

Pasta Party:

TBA

Charities:

We will be working with some local organizations including: Second Chance Animal Sanctuary and Wellsboro High School.

Coaching:

Do you need a little extra help and motivation? We also offer a 14-week individual training plan with one on one coaching (if needed) upon registration! Please contact us at schuylkillriverrunners@gmail.com for more information.

Wellsboro:

The combination of beauty, forests, stores and rich history of this area make this a sure-fire destination race for a summer weekend getaway!

Check us out at www.SchuylkillRiverRunners.com

Email:  schuylkillriverrunners@gmail.com

race.name: "For Your Health" 5k Run/Walk & 1-Mile Fun Walk
race.description: Licking Memorial Health Systems exists to improve the health of the community. The objective of the For Your Health 5k Run/Walk & 1-Mile Fun Walk is to offer a community event that encourages a healthy lifestyle. The Dawes Arboretum is the perfect setting for a 5k run/walk and 1-mile fun walk.

race.name: "Great Allegheny" Ohiopyle Half Marathon, 10k and 5k
race.description:
"Great Allegheny"  Ohiopyle Half Marathon, 10k and 5k


Dates: Saturday April 18th, 2020 (5k, 10k) & Sunday April 19th, 2020  (1/2 Marathon) Take the "Ohiopyle Falls Challenge" and RUN them ALL!!

Sat- 5k and 10k Starting and ending on the Great Allegheny Passage with the routes going to the right (Out & Back)                                                                                

Sun- 1/2 Marathon Going to the left (Out & Back) on the Great Allegheny Passage  

Times: 4/18/2020  5k 8:00AM, 10k 9:00AM, 4/19/2020 1/2 Marathon 8:00AM    

Address:  7 Sheridan St Ohiopyle Pa this is the Laurel Highlands information center.  The Parking lot off this trail is where all 3 Races will Start & Finish                                                                                                                      

Course: All 3 Races will transpire on the Great Allegheny Passage Rail Trail (Pretty Flat & Fast)  with Scenery that will RIVAL any race in the country!!  You will cross bridges over rivers and see majestic waterfalls with beauty abound this will be one event sure to please!!   They Consider Ohiopyle the Crown Jewel of the Commonwealth!!

 Bib Pick-up & Registration: Will take place  Near the Start/Finish line (7 Sheridan St Ohiopyle Pa)  Starting at 6:30AM on 4/18/202, You will be able to pick up your 1/2 Marathon packet as well!!   Also, we may do a Friday afternoon and night option as well!!

Lodging: Visit-  https://www.tripadvisor.com/HotelsNear-g53373-d106590-Ohiopyle_State_Park-Ohiopyle_Pennsylvania.html

Parking:   You will find Parking in the LOT next to 7 Sheridan St Ohiopyle Pa, there are also plenty of parking lots within walking distance nearby!! 

Aid Stations: There will be aid stations w/first aid, Water and Gatorade Approx: every two miles!!  (Some may even have a few treats!!) We will also have paramedics on course

FEES: Half marathon- $55 until  8/1/2019, $60 until 10/1/2019, $70 until 1/1/2020, $75 until 3/1/2020, $80 until Race Day (IF not sold out)  5k, $20 until 8/1/2019, $25 until 10/1/2019, $30 until 1/1/2020, $35 until 3/1/2020, $40 until Race Day..... 10k $25 until 8/1/2019, $35 until 10/1/2019, $40 until 1/1/2020, $45 until 3/1/2020, $50 until race day..... Challenge $80 until 8/1/2019, $90 until 10/1/2019, $100 until 1/1/2020, $110 until $3/1/2020, $120 until Race Day (IF NOT SOLD OUT)

Awards:  Top 3 Male & Female to go with top masters Male & Female (40+.) There will also be age group awards for both male and female runners.

Age Groups: (Both ½,  5K & 10k) -19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34,35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70+

T-Shirts: Amazing race themed Short sleeve tech shirt!!

Finisher’s Medals:  Unique Medal Symbolic for Ohiopyle will be awarded to all Participants in the 1/2, 10k & 5k!!!! We will also have an additional Medal for those running the Ohiopyle Falls Challenge!! 

Time Limit:  4 Hours

Finish Line/After Party: There will be a live DJ/Entertainer at the start/finish area during the duration of the race.  We will have Pizza Post Race!! Thanks to our Sponsors:  Paddlers Pizza (https://www.ohiopylebakery.com/the-pizza-shoppe.html)  & Ohiopyle Bakery (https://www.ohiopylebakery.com/menu.html)

Charities:  Our Main Charity will be the Ohiopyle - Stewart Volunteer Fire Department!! They are amazing and represent Ohiopyle very well!!

Coaching:  Do you need a little extra help and motivation? We also offer a 14-week individual training plan with one on one coaching (if needed) upon registration! Please contact us @ schuylkillriverrunners@gmail.com for more information.

Ohiopyle:  The combination of Water Falls, Trails, Bridges, Scenery and History is tough to beat!!  This is TRULY a unique place and a CROWN JEWEL!!  For more on whats available you can visit here:  https://www.laurelhighlands.org/outdoors/ohiopyle/

PA Wilds Series:  Four Destination Races all located in the PA Wilds!!  Races will  Consist of  the "Great Allegheny" Ohiopyle April 18th, 19th, Run for the Elk August 8th, 9th, Conquer the Canyon July 25th & 26th (registration not open yet) plus a fall event on October 25th and 26th 2020 (registration not open yet)   Participants that run ALL 4 will receive a SPECIAL Medal at the end of the year!!

Check us out @ www.SchuylkillRiverRunners.com

Email:  schuylkillriverrunners@gmail.com

race.name: "Life" is Good! 5k, 10k and Free Kids Fun Run
race.description:
Join us for our 6th Annual “LIFE” is Good 5k & 10k benefiting the Pregnancy Care Center. This is a fun and special event that supports the FREE & confidential services provided by the PCC and held on the beautiful campus of River City Community Church. Bring the whole family to run, walk or jog and enjoy food and music after! There’s also a FREE Kids Run for those 10 & under!

AWARDS AND PERKS:

· Each 5K & 10K registrant will receive a tech shirt & finisher’s medal. The race is chip timed.

· Awards to Top M/F, Top M/F Masters, Top M/F in age groups (14 & under, 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49…70+).

race.name: "Miles That Matter" 5K & 10K
race.description:
Come out and enjoy an amazing community event and impact lives.

 ACTS Miles That Matter Run/Walk 5K 10K is a beautiful course in Warsaw, IN.  Both distances will give you a view of Pike Lake and include an amazing finish as you go through the Beyer Farm trail.  Runners and walkers have said this is a wonderful course and can't wait to participate each year.  Water will be available throughout the course.  

The 5K and 10K is a timed race and your race results will be available to you quickly and accurately.  We are proud to have 5 year age groups in the 5k; Awesome medals for the top 3 in each age group.  In the 10K it is a 9 year age group with top 3 in each age group receiving medals.  We will have overall winner Awards for male and female for both the 5K and 10K distances.  

We have TH Timing assisting in our event and are the best in the area at run/walk events.

With this event we are giving back to our community.  We will be making a donation towards paying school lunch balances for selected Warsaw Community Schools students.  

Come run or walk to help families in our community and families in Haiti.

Register now to win a Garmin watch! Register by June 1st to enter into the drawing.  There is a $2.50 entry fee for online registration and taxes.  

Pre-registration is open now until July 3rd.  Includes t-shirt and fee is  $25 plus fees.  After July 3rd registration is $30 plus fees and no shirt is guaranteed.

5K age group: 11 & under; 12-15; 16-19; 20-24; 25-29; 30-34; 35-39; 40-44; 45-49; 50-54; 55-59; 60-64; 65 & over

10K age group: 16 & under; 17-25; 26-34; 35-43; 44-52; 53 & over.

race.name: "REC" & ROLL!  PPCA's 4th Annual 5K Run/Walk & Kids Run for Auburndale Parks and Recreation
race.description:
Join us for our 4th Annual Polk Pre-Collegiate Academy (PPCA) 5K Run/Walk!

Runners and walkers alike will enjoy the scenic course of the Lake Myrtle Sports Complex in Auburndale. Participants will enjoy the energy, fitness, and fun the event brings to the community. Proceeds from the 5K will benefit students wanting to participate in the City of Auburndale Parks and Recreation Department youth recreation programs. 

The City of Auburndale’s Parks and Recreation Department is dedicated to developing and maintaining facilities that enhance the quality of life and opportunities for students.  Auburndale Parks and Recreation establishes youth programs, maintains athletic fields and courts, services family-friendly parks and picnic areas, historic museums, and safe playgrounds.  You can show your support of youth recreation programs by supporting our PPCA "Rec" & Roll 5K and Kids Run charity event through race participation, monetary donations, and/or auction basket sponsorship. Proceeds from the event will also benefit Polk Pre-Collegiate Academy's programs.

Early registration until 3/15/20:  $25; afterwards $30. 

Event Amenities: Musical performances heard throughout the course.  All participants receive a finishers medal.  Awards are presented to top finishers in specific age categories:  Top three M/F beginning with 11 years of age to 90.  Age groups are divided into 5-year increments.  Registrations by 11:59 p.m., March 15th, 2020 are guaranteed a custom race t-shirt.  Extra shirts may be available on race day.  Water stations, clocks at 1 and 2 miles. Post-race food for 5K participants with bib number.  Extra shirts are limited.  

Safety is priority. Bicycles, roller blades/skates and dogs are prohibited on the course. Run/walk etiquette is encouraged. Strollers/joggers must start behind all runners. Stroller/jogger operators must yield the right of way to runners/walkers.  Participants are expected to exercise caution on the Van Fleet Trail and Lake Myrtle Sports Complex course.

race.name: "Run For The Elk" Half Marathon, 5k/10k & 2Mile Sprint
race.description:
"Run For The Elk" Half Marathon, 5k/10k, 2 Mile Downhill Sprint or take the Rut or Rut Jr. Challenge 

Dates: Saturday August 8th, 2020 (5k, 10k) & Sunday August 9th, 2020  (1/2 Marathon, 2Mile Downhill Sprint) or Take the "Rut Challenge" and RUN them ALL!!

Saturday- 5k and 10k will take place at Parker Dam State Park  Address-    28 Fairview Rd, Penfield, PA 15849     5K will start at 7:00AM 10k will start at 8:00AM 

Parking- will be at Parker Dam State Park on site near the Start/Finish for both the 5k/10k & 1Mile

Courses-  Will be right through the heart of the Wilds!!  The 5k will be a pretty easy out and back course along  Mud Run Rd (Paved Road)  With Approx. 150 feet of elevation change.  The 10k will follow the 5k course then go another 1.55 on the other side of the lake (Fairview Rd) it will be a paved/dirt rd right through the forest!!  The courses will be VERY scenic and sure to please!!  Few Places in PA can compare to the Wilds!! 

Sunday- Run for the Elk Half Marathon & 2Mile Sprint-  Half Marathon Will Start at 7AM with the 2Mile starting  at 7:30AM

Courses:  1/2 Marathon will be a point to point race.  Shuttles will take Participants to the Starting line on Dent's Run Rd. Race will PASS the famous Winslow Hill Viewing Area and will end at The Benezette Winery (196 2nd St, Benezette, PA 15821.) The route will have some elevation  with a 1.2% Grade and a 2.4% Grade in spots.  However, it will net an over all -decent.   Runners will also have a pretty good chance to see the Elk Herd while Running!!  The 2Mile Down Hill Sprint will Start at the Winslow Hill Viewing area and follows the last two miles of the 1/2 Marathon course which is also the biggest decent!!  (Approx a  -500 foot elevation loss!!)   (Both Courses feature all Paved Rds through the heart of the wilds with extremely unique and scenic stretches!!)  The unique location helps to set comfortable  Temps for a longer summer race!!  Average temperature for this time of year is mid 60-70s!

Rut Challenges-  Rut Challenge- 5k/10k, Half Marathon   Rut Jr.-  5k/10k, 2Mile  The Rut: (mid-September to mid-October, the elk rut is a time when male elk, or bulls, vie for the hearts of their female counterparts!!) 

Parking- Participants will be shuttled in from Saint Mary's High School Located: 977 S St Marys St, St Marys, PA 15857 and shuttled to the starting lines!! Shuttles will start running at 5AM and will Run Continuously during the duration of the events!!   Shuttles will be taking participants back to their vehicles from the winery. 

 Bib Pick-up & Registration:  Saturday's registration will open at 6AM with bib pickup for that day located right near the Start/Finish Line.  You will also be able to pick up Sunday's Half & 2Mile bib here as well!  Bib Pickup will also take place Saturday Afternoon from 1-5PM at Benezette Winery Located:  196 2nd St, Benezette, PA    You May ALSO pickup YOUR Bib on Race Day Sunday near the Start/Finish!!                                                                                                                                    

Aid Stations: There will be stations w/first aid, Water and Gatorade Approx: every two miles of the 1/2 Marathon. (Some may even have a few treats!!) We will also have Paramedics and Porta Pots on the course.  The 5k will have one and the 10k will have two stations.

FEES:  5k-  $30 until Jan. 1st,  $35 until May 1st,  $40 until Race Day  10k- $35 until Jan. 1st, $40 May 1st, $45 until Race Day   1/2 Marathon- $65 until Jan. 1st, $75 April 1st, $80 until June 1st, $85 until Race Day  2Mile Sprint- $30 until Jan. 1st, $35 until May 1st,  $40 until Race Day  Rut Challenge(5k/10k/Half) $85 until Jan. 1st, $95 until April 1st, $105 until June 1st, $115 until Race Day   Rut Jr. (5k/10k/2Mile) $70 until Jan. 1st, $75 until April 1st, $80 until June 1st,  $85 until Race Day  Walk- $10 with NO Shirt, $20 with Shirt  (** We will keep registration open until race day endless SOLD OUT**)

Awards:   "VERY UNIQUE race themed awards" Top 3 Male & Female to go with top masters Male & Female (40+.) There will also be age group awards for both male and female runners.

Team Awards: Special Elk Themed awards to the top 3 teams with the most participants and top 3 fastest!! 

Age Groups: (Both ½,  5K & 10k, 2Mile) -19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34,35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70+

T-Shirts: Amazing race themed Short sleeve tech shirt!!

Finisher’s Medals:  Unique Medals pertaining to the PA Wilds will be awarded to all Participants in the 5k/10k, Half Marathon & 2Mile!!   We will also have an additional Medal for those running the Rut Challenge and Rut Challenge Jr.!!   You COULD Earn up to 4 Medals!!

Time Limit: 1/2 marathon  5 Hours,  5k 1 hour, 10k 90 Minutes, 2Miles no limit

Finish Line/After Party: There will be a live DJ/Entertainer at the start/finish area during the duration of the races.  Sunday will also feature a great selection of food post race to go with a little bit of the Bubbly!!  One complimentary glass of `wine (sangria) or hard apple cider to EVERY RUNNER 21+!!

Benezette- is the ”Elk Capital of Pennsylvania” and is located in the heart of the state’s wild elk herd, now numbering almost 1,000 majestic animals. One of the best spots to start an elk viewing adventure is at the Winslow Hill viewing area. The Mt. Zion Historical Park near Benezette is a beautiful and quiet place with an honor walkway and Civil War, Veterans, and Boy Scout memorials. The nearby Quehanna Wild Area features a spectacular White Birch grove in the Marion Brooks Natural Area.  Plus, the town has some amazing gift shops and stores!!

Proceeds-  Part of the Proceeds will Benefit- Friends of Parker Dam State Park  Link:  https://www.facebook.com/FriendsofParkerDamStatePark/

PA Wilds Series:  Four Destination Races all located in the PA Wilds!!  Races will  Consist of  the "Great Allegheny" Ohiopyle April 18th, 19th, Run for the Elk August 8th, 9th, Conquer the Canyon July 25th & 26th (registration not open yet) plus a fall event on October 25th and 26th 2020 (registration not open yet)   Participants that run ALL 4 will receive a SPECIAL Medal at the end of the year!!

We'd Be Honored to have YOU Join us as we RUN with the ELK & earn some AMAZING BLING!!!! See why 480,000+ Plus flock to this area annually!!!!

Coaching:  Do you need a little extra help and motivation? We also offer a 14-week individual training plan with one on one coaching (if needed) upon registration! Please contact us @ schuylkillriverrunners@gmail.com for more information.

Check us out @ www.SchuylkillRiverRunners.com

Email:  schuylkillriverrunners@gmail.com

race.name: "Run for your Mother" Quarter Marathon & 5k
race.description:
“Run for your Mother” Quarter Marathon & 5k

Sunday May 10th 2020

Location: 1000 S 8th St Lebanon Pa 17042

Quarter Marathon will start at 8AM and the 5k will kick off 8:10AM with a mile fun run and walk starting at 8:15

Course: Races will start at the High School and follow the rail trail for an easy, fast out & back.

 Bib Pick-up & Registration:  we will have bib pick-up on Race Day.  You will be able to register day of as well......

Parking: On Site Parking @The High School

Aid Stations: There will be two aid stations w/first aid, Water & Gatorade on course.

FEES: Quarter Marathon: $40 until 3/1/2020, $45 till 5/10/2020, $50 race day if applicable,  5k $30 until 3/1/2020, $35 till 5/10/2020, $40 race day if applicable, 1 Mile Fun/Run $10

Awards:  Top  Male & Female to go with the following age group awards for both male and female runners....

Age Groups: (Both ½ & 5K) 13-19, 20-29, 25-29, 30-39,35-39, 40-49, 45-49, 50-59, 55-59, 60-69, 70+

T-Shirts & Amenities (1/4M&5k): Pretty Pink/Red Mother’s day Themed Short sleeve tech shirt to go with a Finisher’s Medal Symbolic w/Mother’s day and some special chocolate!!!!!!!

Finish Line: There will be a live DJ/Entertainer at the start/finish area during the duration of the race

Check us out @ www.SchuylkillRiverRunners.com

Email:  schuylkillriverrunners@gmail.com

race.name: "RUNNING LUNGS 2018" V I R T U A L 5K-10K-13.1K - R A C E S - START IN ROCHESTER, MN & GOES WORLD WIDE
race.description:
-November Lung Cancer Awareness Month-

                              Save Lungs & Lives      Race+Research=Results

                  R U N N I N G  L U N G S  “V I R T U A L”  Run/Walk/Fun 2019

                   Begins in ~R O C H E S T E R, MN~ & Now goes WORLDWIDE

                             10K                     HALF Marathon                5K
                          $35.00                        $40.00                    $30.00

 

Register online & simply choose your own start line, treadmill, street, trail & run whenever. We will mail your: SWAG, Finisher Medal, Award, T-shirt & Peak Flow Meter

 

~SIGN UP NOW FOR YOUR FREE LUNG HEALTH RESEARCH STUDY~

www.WortmanLungCancerFoundation.org/research/

 

“MAYO CLINIC & Wortman Foundation LONGITUDINAL LUNG HEALTH STUDY”….which through simple online questionnaires is creating a data base to evaluate the influence of genetics, habits, and environmental exposures on lung health and the development of lung diseases. Sign up on our Research Page using the sign up button.

Together, our goal is to better understand the link between environment, lifestyle and genetics on lung health and to accelerate research, education and provide desperately needed funding for the prevention of lung disease. All proceeds donated to Mayo Clinic.

   Race Information Call: (406) 570-4037      WortmanLungCancerFoundation@gmail.com

RunLike"L" & Save Lungs & Lives - Meet The Mayo Clinic Lung Health Research Team & Sign Up for FREE Lung Study    NOTE:   `ALL RACE PROCEEDS DONATED TO MAYO CLINIC LUNG CANCER & LUNG HEALTH RESEARCH

address.street2: Run or Bike With L a 12 year survivor!

race.name: "Sweet 'N' Salty" 5k/10k
race.description:
3rd ANNUAL SWEET & SALTY 5k/10k

"Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of bacon!!"

Location/Registration: Norristown Farm Park- 2500 Upper Farm Rd
Norristown, PA US 19402

Course:  Both races will be looped courses through the scenic Norristown Farm Park. The  courses will be EXTREMELY well marked and runner friendly!!

Amenities:  EVERY runner will receive a unique custom finisher's medal and T-Shirt (LAST day TO GUARANTEE a T-Shirt is Wednesday 6/26, Then it will be first come, first serve while supplies last) to commemorate the event & holiday to go with a few slices of  BACON!!  Also, EACH participant will  receive ice cream courtesy of Merrymead Farm in Lansdale PA!!

Awards: Top 3 over all M+F in both races will receive special awards plus Top masters M + F and Awards to the Top 3 in the following age groups: 14 and under 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59, 60-69, 70+ Plus a special award to the runners who are dressed the most festive!! (These awards will be sure to Please!!)

Teams: (MUST have at least 5 participants, 5k ONLY) We will also have team awards!!  We will award the top 2 teams based on times.  We will also give a special award to the team with the most representatives!!  The winning teams will receive Cup Trophies!! (Team Participants will STILL be eligible for ALL individual awards!!)

Entry Fee: 5k/10k $25 until March 1st,  $30 till April 1st, $35 until June 1st, $40 till race day and $45 day of (if NOT sold out) 10k is $5 more after March 1st

Professionally chip timed
For additional information visit the Schuylkill River Runners’ website at www.SchuylkillRiverRunners.com  

We would be HONORED if you'd join us for this amazing event!!  "Life, Liberty and the Pursuit of bacon!!"

race.name: "Take the Lake"
race.description:
Race day: Saturday, June 6th, 2020

All participants registering by May 28, 2020 will be guaranteed a Performance Diploma Dash - "Take The Lake" T-Shirt. A limited number of shirts may be available for race day registrations while supplies last.

On Saturday, June 6th, the Sheboygan Public Education Foundation will host a 1 mile grade school run/walk as well as a 5K run/walk. "Take the Lake” will commemorate educational achievement in Sheboygan as the run/walk will start and end at Vollrath Park, the historic site of the Sheboygan Area School District’s graduation.

Community members, businesses, students, faculty, friends, family and run/walkers join us at this event celebrating not only the Class of 2020 but Sheboygan and its pursuit of excellence in education. Get a team together if you like. Kick off this festive weekend with some fun for a great cause.The 9th Annual "Take The Lake" will commemorate educational achievement in Sheboygan as the run/walk will start and end at Vollrath Park, the historic site of the Sheboygan Area School District's high school graduation.

All proceeds from this event will benefit the Sheboygan Public Education Foundation in our mission to support educational programming in our Sheboygan public schools.

PACKET PICK-UP: First Congregational Church, Lucas Hall - 310 Bluff Avenue

Friday, June 5th: 2:00-6:00pm

Saturday, June 6th: 7:00-8:15am (RACE DAY!)

Race will begin at 8:30 AM. 

 

ONLINE Registrations closes at midnight June 2, 2020. You can still register at the Sheboygan YMCA Main Desk and SPEF Office (605 North 8th Street Suite 214) until Thursday, June 4 AND at First Congregational Church Lucas Hall on Friday, June 5 (2 - 4 p.m.) AND Day of Race - Saturday, June 6 (7:15 - 8:15 a.m.)

Come Join the Fun!

race.name: "The Augúst - Montana's Second Oldest Footrace"
race.description:
53rd running of "The Augúst - Montana's Second Oldest Footrace." 5k trail run - flat & fast! Starts at 7:00 PM at Spring Meadow Resources Pavilion (2850 Broadwater Ave). $10 entry fee, online or in-person (race day registration opens at 6:00 PM). Fundraiser for local high school cross-country teams. This is the ultimate, minimalist, no frills race -- who needs t-shirts, awards, or door prizes, when you can have fast times, accurate results, friendly volunteers, loads of tradition, and a warm feeling for supporting a worthy cause?
Contact: Patrick Judge, 406/459-5838, pljudge@bresnan.net
“au-gúst - adj. marked by majestic dignity or grandeur” - Webster

race.name: "THE HALF - Presented by Charity For Children (Green Lakes State Park)
race.description:
MAY 31st, 2020 | SUNDAY MORNING 

Join us on Sunday, May 31th, 2020 for "THE HALF"...This is a premier running event hosted by and to benefit Charity for Children.  Featured races include i"The HALF"( Half-Marathon), 5K Run, 5K "youth division" Run, 2-Mile "trail walk", and a Kids 1/2 Mile Fun-Run.  

"The Half" (half-marathon) course blends road, Canal Path, and trails at Green Lakes for a fast, "easy on the legs" course with over 7 miles in the shade!

The 5K "trail run" starts on the beach path and runs the beautiful wooded trails around the lakes, while the 2-Mile "Trail Walk" and Kids (1/2 mile) Fun-Run both offer a great experience for the entire family and brings to light the mission of the Charity for Children and why we do what we do.

Here's the Swag!! (except the "Youth Division 5k/ Kids Fun-Run):

  • Custom "THE HALF" Race Shirt
  • Custom "The Half" Bib*
  • Finisher’s Medal - The HALF (Half Marathoner's Only)
  • Post race food & drink
  • Gannon's Isle Homemade Ice Cream 
  • Hydration/aid stations along the course
  • Porta-potties along the course
  • Entertainment (music, kids activities, etc.)
  • Age-Group awards (The Half, 5K Run, 5K "youth division" Run)
  • Premier Brand Overall race winner awards include...

*These items exclusive to Half-Marathon finishers.

PACKET PICKUP/ LAST-MINUTE REGISTRATION
DATE/TIME:  Saturday May 30th - 10am - 2pm
LOCATION: Fleet Feet Dewitt (or, starting at 6am race day at Green Lakes "Community Room")

DATE/TIME: Race Day, Sunday - May 31st,  7:00 AM – 1:00 PM
LOCATION: Green Lakes State Park, 7900 Green Lakes Road, Fayetteville, NY

SPECIAL PARKING NOTE:  THE PARK BEGINS CHARGING CARS $8 AT 8AM RACE MORNING, SO PLAN TO HAVE ANY SUPPORTERS/ FRIENDS SHOW UP BEFORE THEN!

OFFICIAL SITE FOR THE HALF - General Info, Map, Info about Charity For Children.

race.name: #Be A Buddy 5K
race.description:
#BeABuddy 5K Run/Walk & Family Health and Fitness Expo at Space Coast Field of Dreams on Saturday, October 31 2019 from 9 AM-12 PM! Stand Up! Be A Buddy! Get Moving with your family, friends and your community on the Space Coast! Our 2019 Celebrity Grand Marshal ASHLEY NOLAN from CBS' Survivor will start off our 5K and free family activities and fitness events will follow, complete with Free Kids Fun Run!

Race Amenities include:

  • Cool Race Shirt (or save $5.00 with the No Shirt Option)
  • Post-Race Family Health and Fitness Expo highlighting local
    vendors and sponsors and kids sports demos! 
  • Halloween Kids Fun Run and Costume Contest!
  • DJ/Entertainment
  • Post-Race Local Food and Beverages
  •  
  • Win Prizes

Over 13 million children will be bullied this year. Not only are the effects of bullying on a child felt immediately, they can also be lifelong - or even tragic. That’s why The Parker Foundation for Autism and Child Development and other local organizations invite you to join us as we rally around our students, families, and our community to raise awareness of bullying, prevention efforts AND enjoy free family fitness activities at the Expo after the Race!

The Parker Foundation provides free resources to children with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) and related disabilities and their families through funding education, sports and arts programs. Our #BeABuddy 5K celebrates our bullying prevention initiatives, empowers our Peer Buddy Program, and unites the community in a campaign to keep all youth safe from bullying.

  • *If any Youth would like to receive a bullying prevention themed Finisher Medal and a T-shirt, they must register for the 5K Youth Run/Walk (Under 16 years old). Youth are all welcome to run or walk the 5K and will receive a Finisher Medal and T-shirt that can be worn and treasured all year! We are hosting a Free Kids Unity Dash after the 5K is completed (around 10:15 AM) at the Start/Finish Line for kids over a fun 200-yard distance just near the Start/Finish Line Area. If the Youth 5K Registrant would rather only participate in the Dash, we will make sure they receive their Finisher Medal and T-Shirt at the Finish Line or the Race Registration Tent! 

TIME TABLE:

Friday, October 30th 10:00 AM – 6:30 PM
Packet Pickup & Registration at Running Zone
3696 N. Wickham Road, Melbourne, FL 32935

Saturday, October 31st – Space Coast Field of Dreams
3000 Minton Road,  Melbourne, FL 32935
8:00 AM          Packet Pickup & Registration
8:45 AM          Late Registration for 5K ends
9:00 AM          5K Start
10:15 AM        Free Kids Run will begin!
*Awards Ceremony immediately following the race

AWARDS: Male/Female
Top 3 Overall
Top Masters (40+)

Top Grand Masters (50+)

Top Senior Grand Masters (60+) 

M-F:  Age Groups (Top 3 in each age group):
8 & Under        25-29          50-54              75-79
9-11                30-34           55-59              80+
12-14               35-39          60-64
15-19                40-44         65-69
20-24              45-49            70-74
Fastest Team, Largest Team and Most Team Spirit!

race.name: #NFStrong 5K for Neurofibromatosis
race.description:
Join us at the

11th Annual
#NFStrong 5K for Neurofibromatosis

#NFStrong is back for year #11 in Memphis, TN! Each year, our #NFStrong event extends the Halloween celebration with superheroes and costumes, and this year's event will be the best yet with:

  • food and games
  • face painting and crafts
  • costumed superheroes
  • NF tattoos and NF Champion medals
  • 5K Finisher medals for 5K Run event
  • a raffle with fabulous prizes, and more! 

#NFStrong events take place in communities nationwide. These inspiring events create strong bonds that build a supportive NF community. The goal of these strong communities is to rally together and become one great voice in finding effective treatments and an eventual cure for NF. The events are a great way to involve family and friends, meet others who are affected by NF, while raising awareness of this disorder and to create funding for NF research.

race.name: #StayActive 5k
race.description:
The Union County Health Department is celebrating a healthy Union County by encouraging individuals to Stay Active Year Round!

Unfortunately, just like everyone else in the US, Union County's obesity rates are high, in our case higher than state and national averages. Unlike other areas, Union County has a nice network of trails and plans to expand them, so we would like to encourage people to get out and move no matter the weather or time of year!


Your call to action for the Stay Active Year Round campaign for the spring is to participate in the #StayActive 5k. The race starts at Mill Creek Park (by the soccer fields) and runs up the Jim Simmons Trail into Mill Valley North and then back over the pedestrian bridge. All proceeds benefit the Union County Health Department and allow us to provide mini-grants to local schools to encourage youth to learn life long health habits like running and walking!

 

Packet Pickup:
March 13, 2020
10:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.
Union County Health Department
940 London Ave #1100, Marysville, OH 43040

race.name: #TeamSISD Run for Reading"
race.description:
#TeamSISD Run for Reading"
5K Run & 1 Mile Family Fun / Run Walk
Saturday, April 25, 2020 / 8:00 a.m. start
SISD Student Activities Complex
1300 Joe Battle, El Paso TX 79928

REGISTRATION FEES
Individual registration:  $25.00
Students 18 and under: $15.00
Team registration: $20 per team member
(TEAMS MUST HAVE A MINIMUM OF 10 MEMBERS TO QUALIFY FOR TEAM DISCOUNT. First 9 team members to register will pay regular price and receive a $5 refund when the 10th team member registers.  Everyone after that to join the team pays the discounted price.)

Race Day Registration:  $30.00  

 

RUNNERS & WALKERS RECEIVE RACE T-SHIRT  

ONLINE REGISTRATION- (plus applicable fees), NO LATER THAN Wednesday, April 22, 2020 AT WWW.RACEADVENTURESUNLIMITED.COM    REGISTRATION FEES ARE NON-REFUNDABLE

Friday, April 24, 2020 @ Up and Running Store on 1475 George Dieter 3:30-7:00 p.m.

Refreshments available at finish line

The race ends in the SISD stadium, where athletes enjoy a victory lap around the football field before crossing the finish line. race.name: $5 5K
race.description: Pirate Perry is ready to give back to our local running community....we just want to get everyone together for a 5K, have some fun, and give away some sweet schwag!

race.name: $5 Frozen 5k
race.description: No frills 5k. No t-shirts, no medals, just a nice cold 5k. I am going to be testing out some race tracking software for this race. So if you run with your phone people will be able to track you during the race. I can't guarantee that it will work perfect which is why I'm testing at this race. The race will begin at 700 s. on the Syracuse Trail and be an out an back to Syracuse Arts Academy. Map coming soon.

race.name: 'JINGLE ALL THE 5K/10K/1K' VIRTUAL RUN
race.description:
Kick-start your holiday festivities and outpace that mischievous yeti with the whole family and join us in our first annual ‘Jingle All The 5K, 10K, 1K' virtual run/walk...that is, if you still 'believe'!!!
This 'Medal Dash' virtual run event allows you to simply run/walk/jog a 5K/10K (or even a 1K with your little elves) anytime, anywhere. You can invite your festive friends and choose your location whether that’s on the treadmill, at a park or in your neighborhood. You have from 12.1 through 12.31 to record your time, share with our 2,000+ avid group followers and celebrate with a limited edition of 1,000 yeti collectors medal and tech t-shirt! Come join us and show everyone your best holiday attire and spirit this Christmas season!

race.name: 'Til the Cows Come Home 5K
race.description:
The 7th Annual 'Til the Cows Come Home 5k Trail Run is Friday May 1, 2020! Race start: 7:00PM. 

This evening trail run through Steed's Dairy’s picturesque pastures in Grovetown, GA is something you don't want to miss! All proceeds from this race will benefit the work of Christ Community Health Services Augusta. Their mission is to proclaim Jesus Christ as Lord and demonstrate His love by providing affordable, quality primary healthcare to the under-served. 

Runners, joggers and walkers are all welcome!

**Register by April 12, 2020 to be guaranteed a t-shirt**

Packet pick-up information TBA.

race.name: **** The Mojo Radio Show 0.5k **** The Race for the Rest of Us
race.description:
Join your fellow beer loving, life of the party going, over the top underachievers for the 3rd Annual 0.5k in Downtown Huntsville on March 14th - all to raise money for one very special Gold Star Family. This event is presented by the Mojo Radio Show and Canvas, Inc. Thank you to our event and sponsor Miller's Tavern!

We know what you're thinking. A 0.5k? How FAR is 0.5k? Do I really HAVE to run? What's REALLY happening? 

The course is 0.5k or 0.3 miles or 500 meters, or 1,640.42 feet, or 19,685 inches or something like that. We didn’t really measure it. You can walk, skip, leisurely stroll, roller skate, or whatever it takes to cross the finish line. Just make sure you don’t spill your beer.

You have three options for tickets: 

  1. Baseline tickets are your entry into the race. 
  2. Sprint the race by registering for the Sprinters Package. We'll cheer you on (aka point and laugh at you) as you take to the course first. This was the most popular kids option in 2019! (hint - register your kids for this family race!!)
  3. Be a VIP and ride the course instead.  

Did we mention we’re the Official Sponsors of St. Patrick's Day?
The 0.5k conveniently happens to be scheduled on St. Patrick’s Day, so we’re claiming the official sponsor rights. What does this mean for you? It means, starting at 9am we’re closing off Washington Street between Clinton and North Side Square for a block party like you’ve never seen.

You’ll want a party spot to pitch your pre-race and post-race recovery tent, so make sure you register as a Corporate Sponsor to get this perk. Plus, you’ll be the only ones that can say “meet me at our tent” for total St. Patrick’s Day shenanigans.

The parade goes downtown, (route to be determined), so we’ll pause the party happenings for all to watch the parade go by. Keep in mind - as soon as the parade ends we’re rolling into serious race prep. So be ready.  

To Recap: (Or something like the agenda below. We’re still working out details.)

Saturday, March 14, 2019
9:00 am - 11:30 am      Block Party Shenanigans
11:30 am - 1:00 pm      St. Patrick’s Day Parade Viewing & Block Party Shenanigans
1:00 pm - 2:00pm         The 0.5k
2:00 pm - 4:00 pm        Block Party Shenanigans

NEW THIS YEAR - FOOD TRUCK RALLY! (Thanks Downtown Huntsville Inc) 

Want to know more? Yeah, we do too. Here’s what we’re calling Race Details!

The course is strenuous, but we feel with proper training (hint watch last year's training video) you’ll be able to partake in race day activities. We’ll start at the corner of Washington and Clinton Ave, taking a left onto Clinton Holmes, then a left onto Jefferson. This is the toughest stretch – measuring a whole 200m. To ensure you can make it, we’ll have cheerleaders encouraging you along the way. They may just be tourists, but hey you call them what you want. We’ll hang a left onto Northside Square before making the final left back onto Washington where you’ll see the finish line at the intersection of Washington and North Side Square.

We’re estimating it will take you 10 minutes (if you walk like your grandma) to do the course. When you pass through the finish line in a blaze of glory, you'll return to the block party where you’ll want to relive the experience, brag to your friends, take selfies to post on social media, "I DID IT!!! I'M A FINISHER!! LOOK AT ME!!!"

Conveniently, Miller's has great race day beer specials for your amazing participation.

Still not convinced this is the most epic thing ever? Did we mention…

  • Bring an extra $$$ for some games, raffles and more 
  • You get a T-shirt and medal for showing your friends how awesome you are 
  • Finish line photos
  • Individual and group costume contests with prizes. Cool sunglasses, leprechaun outfits, leisure suits, pajamas, you name it…just do it
  • The race is THE OFFICIAL SPONSOR of St. Patrick’s Day
  • Amazing drink specials at Miller's Tavern (It's like having our own personal bar for the day)
  • Live music
  • Much, much, much more (this is code for as we think of things)

You want some swag? Then listen up!

  • If you want a T-Shirt on race day - and who doesn't want one of these bad boys - you must register prior to March 1. Registrations after that are not guaranteed t-shirts.
  • All finishers will receive a pretentious oval Euro-style 0.5k sticker that you can attach to your rear windshield to show everyone what a badass you are.
  • Participation medals (everyone gets recognized for their hard work at this event. We’re all about positivity and self-worth.
  • Compete in one of our contests and you’ll get awards for your hard work.

Why are we doing this?  To raise money of course.

We know you think it’s all just about beer, and that’s cool, but the one thing we aren’t making light of is our cause of choice. Every dime we raise will go to support a North Alabama Gold Star Widow. In case you don’t know, the term Gold Star describes a family member who has lost a loved one in military service. 

So now, the part you've been waiting for. How much IS this race??

Ticket Options:

$25 – The Baseline Ticket

Congratulations you’re a part of the most epic thing you will ever do. To reward you for your efforts, you will get a T-Shirt, a 0.5k Sticker, a medal and the feeling of knowing you did something really great for someone else.

 

$35 – The Sprinter’s Challenge

Congratulations you’re one step ahead of the rest of us – you actually like to run. Sure, the Sprinter’s Challenge is just a bit more, but that’s okay because you’re a bit extra anyway. To reward you for your serious athleticism, we’re going to let you go first. If you’re awesome enough to sprint it, your awesome enough to do it while holding your beer.  That isn’t s suggestion, but an expectation.

The winner of the Sprinter’s Challenge will get some serious bragging rights. You will also get a T-Shirt, a 0.5k Sticker, a medal and the feeling of knowing you did something really great for someone else.  

 

$50 – The VIP

Congratulations you’re more important than all of us – you’re a VIP. If you like the thought of being ushered in style on the Rocket City Rover Party Bike, then this option is for you! You and 13 of your BFF’s (aren't we all BFF's after a few beers??) are going to make history by participating in the race without ever putting your feet to the pavement.

In case you noticed, the VIP option is just a tad more, but that’s okay because you’re really all about supporting a good cause and that alone is worth being a VIP. However, because you’re such a VIP, you’ll not only get a ride on the ALL NEW Rocket City Rover, you’ll also get a T-Shirt, a 0.5k Sticker, a medal and the feeling of knowing you did something great for someone else.

Give us a donation

Love what you see but you’re super sad you can’t make it? Don’t worry, this is a fundraiser and you can still participate by clicking the donate button. You'll get the ultimate prize of knowing you did something really great for someone else.  

Still have questions? Here's a few answers...

Is this a family friendly event? 

You bet it is. We all have kids too. The only thing the kids can't do is drink the beer because well that's illegal. In 2019, the kids LOVED taking part in the Sprinter's Challenge. So what are you waiting for? Sign up the whole family! It's for a good cause. 

What is there to do at the block party? 

The better question is what isn't there to do!! We'll have all sorts of games and activities, but just to name a few - musical chairs, giant jenga, heads or tails, cornhole, and a whole lot more. We're all about giving things away too, so make sure you register for the good stuff we'll be giving away for game winners. We'll have live music and lots of dancing in the streets. 

Oh and did we mention FOOD TRUCK RALLY?? I'd bring a chair with you for the day, you're not going to have a reason to leave. 

 Do I have to pay to come to the block party? 

Nope! The block party is open for anyone to partake. You do however have to pay to participate in the 0.5k. You will want to bring some extra $$$ though because this is a fundraiser and we'll be asking for donations! Come prepared to party and give!! 

Can I bring my four legged friends? 

If your pups can handle the crowds, we aren't against having them join our shenanigans. Just make sure they don't drink the beer.  

Still have questions?

Want to know how to get more involved? Or better yet, do you want to be a sponsor? Send us all your questions. We can’t promise we’ll know the answer, but we’ll promise we’ll get back to you.

race.name: *Fastest Athlete in Florida Speed Agility Challenge*
race.description:
How fast are you and how do you measure up to other runners?

 

Showcase your speed and fast twitch muscle fibers competing on a Speed Agility Short Course. (115 yards total distance) 

 

Prove how fast your top end speed is by running a TOP END Speed 30 yard dash. (stand tall and fall start position)

 

*2 run attempts in the Top End Speed 30 Dash and the best time wins*

*2 run attempts on the Speed Agility Course and the best time wins*

 

Prove that your are the Fastest Athlete in Florida and sign up today!

-grass surface only event  (no metal cleats or track shoe spikes)

-hand timed start to finish by a certified performance coach with NFL combine experience

**accepting 40 males and 40 females to compete in this event only (18-45 years age restriction group)**

SO HOW FAST IS YOUR FAST?!?!  

Put it on the line and showcase your speed in 2020!

address.street: Elva Rouse Park, N Shore Dr NE & 10th Ave NE, St. Petersburg, FL 33701

race.name: --- Make-A-Wish Mid-Atlantic --- Wish Hero 5K
race.description: Sign up to run in the Make-A-Wish® Mid-Atlantic Wish Hero 5K and make your miles count for wishes! The local organization creates life-changing wishes for children with critical illnesses. By running in this 5K, you can help make wishes come true and be a superhero for local wish kids. Sign up today!

race.name: 08085 Run/Walk/Sit
race.description:
The 08085 Run/Walk/Sit: One mild-mannered zip code … with an event boasting four fantastic options!  To kick off your 2020 Fun Day, join us for one or more of the 3rd annual 08085 Run possibilities.  In zip code order, choose from:

1 . A 0.8 Mile kids’ run/walk (1.29K) - Course along a flat, paved trail within Locke Avenue Park. Adults welcome to register to join the kids.

2. A 0K sit (approximately no miles) - Course along a comfortable chair of your choosing. All the stuff with little-to-none of the sweat!

3. An 8K run (4.96 miles) - Mostly out-and-back course mostly along High Hill Road but only featuring gentle, rolling hills less imposing than the road’s name suggests.

4. A 5K run/walk (3.1 miles) - Less-challenging course only half on High Hill Road.

race.name: 1 Mile Marathon Challenge
race.description:
RunStrong Events and Iron Sharp Fitness are excited to announce the inaugural 1 Mile Marathon Challenge!

How fast can you and friends run a marathon?? Find out at the inaugural 1 Mile Marathon Challenge!

Teams from 2 to 5 runners will run a full marathon in 1 mile increments on the same out and back 1 mile route. (The course starts at RunStrong HQ, runners then turn around at the marked turnaround spot and return to the start where the next runner from the team will begin their 1 mile leg,  The final runner will run 2.2 miles to finish 26.2 total miles.

Teams of fewer than 5 runners will be allowed, but 5 is the maximum allowed. Teams may run in any order they choose, but all the run legs must be done on the established course in 1 mile increments.

Each participant will receive a race t-shirt and finisher's swag. RunStrong events are as much a social event as a race, and there will be plenty of awesome food and drinks available to participants before, during, and after the event. 

The course will start and finish at the RunStrong Training Center and will be a half mile out and half mile back on the paved multi use trail. It will be a challenging course with a couple rolling hills to tackle.

Participants will have access to the RunStrong Training Center and the adjacent Iron Sharp facilities to drop gear bags, take showers, and use restrooms.

To register, the team captain can create your team during the registration process, and participants registering subsequently can join their team during the registration process. Registration fees will be per participant, not per team, as each participant receives race swag and food. 

There will be awards given for fastest team of each size.

race.name: 1-Miler, 5K and 22K to End Veteran Suicide
race.description: 1st annual 1-Miler, 5K and 22K to End Veteran Suicide. We must stand up and put a end to veteran suicide. Please join J&Z’s Boutique and The Ruyts Foundation of Veteran Suicide Prevention Incorporated as we band together to help end Veteran Suicide! While one person may not make a difference we believe those that band together can and will! Suicide needs to become a thing of the past! Let’s help our hero’s fight the battles they can no longer fight alone!

race.name: 1.25.20 THE GREAT AMAZING RACE Charleston adventure run/walk for adults & kids
race.description:
America's Most Popular Amazing Race Style Series ~ Donate Sneakers for Cancer!

Only $49.99 per team

Reserve your spots now, you can create your teams later on race day. (Each race caps at 100 teams)  

THE GREAT AMAZING RACE SERIES     

    This is your chance to test your "AMAZING RACE" skills.  Modeled after the TV show, contestants pair up with a friend, family member or co-worker ~ and compete against other similar age teams. V show? 
   2 person teams race around a 1.5 mile cross country course with multiple task stations.  Clue cards provided at various stations along the course direct teams to complete a task, either together or by a single member, before continuing to race. How well you work together with your partner (aka TEAMWORK) is the #1 most important skill to win the race. Teams strive to arrive at finish line with fastest overall times to be declared the winners. This race is way more fun than any 5K race!  

1. Open for ages 4 to 84 ... walkers, joggers & runners. 
2. 2 person teams (any combo) ... adult/adult, adult/kid or kid/kid. 
3. 2 courses ... difficult for adults & active teams / easier for kids & leisure teams.
4. Average time to complete course is 60 minutes.

VOLUNTEER & RACE FOR FREE. - Sign up at www.GreatAmazingRace.com. 

SOCIAL SHARING - Share with 10+ friends on social media & receive a Great Amazing Race backpack at race ($15 value).

SPONSORSHIPS - Become a booth sponsor for only $200.  Details at www.GreatAmazingRace.com. 

HOST A RACE - Host a race & earn $4,000 for your group, school or club.  Details at www.GreatAmazingRace.com. 

TEAM BUILDING EVENT - we conduct group & team building events as well.  Details at www.GreatAmazingRace.com.

race.name: 1.26.20 THE GREAT AMAZING RACE Columbia adventure run/walk for adults & kids
race.description:

race.name: 1/10th of a Mile Move
race.description:
The inspiration is to get people off the couch and in motion doing something, anything that gets people “moving" ... walk... wheel... hike... run... bike... swim... anything that gets them to take the first step... pedal... stroke... to baby step their mind and body to move...

get your sneakers on... dust off your bike... or get your swimmies on... let’s have some fun and get your family and friends together to start moving... #tagyoureit #tagwereallit because #couchkills ... “sitting is the new smoking”

Grab some friends, coworkers, pets and/or family and register for our virtual event. Virtual events can be done anywhere you are: on a treadmill at home or at the gym, at the beach, with friends, alone, in the evening, or at the break of dawn. It's your choice. Register for our virtual event and complete your 1/10th mile at your convenience and post your picture or video to our Facebook or Instagram Page.

What is a 1/10th of Mile?

528 Feet

7 laps of a 25 yard pool

6.5 laps of a 25 meter pool

2 lengths of a football field

1.5 times around a baseball diamond

1/2 way around a track

2 lengths of a soccer field

225 steps

race.name: 10 Annual Chippewa Challenge Indoor Triathlon
race.description:
This is an indoor triathlon hosted at the Student Activity center on the campus of Central Michigan University. This event will consist of swim, bike, and run. Each leg will last for 20 minutes with five minute transitions between. The race is scored on who travels the farthest in the allotted time. This event is hosted by the Triathlon Club at CMU and is open to everyone of all abilities.

Registration fee is $35 and Registration is available on active.com

race.name: 100 Laps of Healing
race.description:
ABOUT: On August 17th, 2014, Bill Mather ran 100 laps around the Hillsborough High School Track on behalf of the families supported by Steps Together.  (It was actually 105 laps to make it a full 26.2 marathon distance.) He had run his first 5K with Steps Together so it only seemed fitting that his first marathon be for steps Together. He named his event 100 Laps of Healing and it was a huge success on many levels.  The event raised awareness about Steps Together, awareness about the families we help, it also brought our beneficiaries and community together on the track all while raising funds for our organization.

2020 will mark the 7th100 Laps of Healing event which has now raised over $30,000 for Steps Together. In 2015, our community came out and walked or ran 5,459 laps or 1,364.75 miles. That's been a record we've been trying to break since that date.  Can you help us in 2020?

THE EVENT IS FREE! We invite your entire family, all fitness levels, young and old, to come out and be a part of this event. Consider surprising us with your inner wild by wearing something crazy fun!

  • Arrive at the track anytime between 7 AM and 11 AM. 
  • Sign a short waiver (if you didn't register online already) and begin walking or running. Lanes 1 - 3 reserved for runners, 4 - 6 for walkers. 
  • When finished, write the number of laps completed and drop it in the lap jar.
  • No strollers and no dogs!
  • At the end of the event, the laps of our entire community will be tallied.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

  • Encourage friends to donate to your effort. (Flat donations and per lap pledges accepted)
  • Organize a team and set a lap goal. Throw in a little competition and challenge another team!
  • Be an event sponsor to bring your own tent, table and signage to put track side. ($250)
  • Be a mile sponsor and Bill will wear your shirt for one of his 26.2 miles. ($25)
  • Make a general donation to Bill just because he’s awesome and running 100 Laps of Healing on the track.
  • Start a fundraising page to raise funds for Steps Together with your own laps!
  • Volunteer
  • Donate food, baked goods or water for our participants.

race.name: 100on100 Relay 2020
race.description:
A van full of your closest friends, 100 miles of scenic Vermont running, and an endless supply of memories – this is NOT your average running event! The 100 on 100 Relay is a challenging relay experience where friends converge from across the country to complete 100 demanding miles together along Vermont’s historic Route 100. Push beyond your limits, lean on your teammates, and complete something extraordinary.

Do it for the challenge, stay for the party.

At the finish, you’ll share your stories from the course with other runners while enjoying awesome food, music, and beer! Run your heart out, eat your heart out, and (responsibly) drink your heart out. You’ve earned it.

race.name: 100th Statuto Race
race.description:
Running strong for 100 years!
The Statuto Race commemorates the creation of the first Italian Constitution (Statuto Albertino) and is a running tradition in San Francisco going back 100 years. The first Statuto Race was held in North Beach in 1919. It has been run every year, except for one year during World War II. The 2020 race marks the 100th edition of this iconic race!

race.name: 10k at 10,000 Feet
race.description:
Voted best 10k in the state of Colorado by Colorado Runner Magazine in 2010!

This is a challenging trail run with beautiful terrain and breathtaking scenery. The 10K race begins at 10,000 ft at the summit of Rabbit Ears Pass. The course begins by heading uphill on USFS dirt roads and 2 track, and then then heads downhill on single-track, ending on a cross country single-track. The total elevation gain and loss are about ~1,200 feet each.

*Although this race is listed as a 10k, the actual distance comes out to 6.8 miles. We will have one aid station on the course about 3.4 miles in (the 5k race option does not have an aid station). We HIGHLY recommend that you bring your own water.

address.street: Summit of the old Rabbit Ears Pass Road, Monument Parking lot

race.name: 10K on the Bay
race.description:
Run or walk along the Bay Trail and enjoy breathtaking views of the San Francisco Bay-Estuary.
Participate in a 5K or 10K. Proceeds from this event help to maintain and enhance the educational programs,
exhibits, and facilities of the Hayward Shoreline Interpretive Center.

race.name: 10K Run for Music
race.description:
Packet Pick Up is 10:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. Fri., April 3th at Naples on the Run (20 10th St. S, Naples, FL, 34102) or race day starting at 6 a.m. at Artis—Naples.

Presented by the Friends of Artis—Naples - proceeds benefit Artis—Naples’ youth education programs. The best competitive 10K race in the greater Naples area!

10K Event Pricing

Until April 30 2019 - $20

May 1 - February 29, 2020 - $30

March1 - April 3rd - $35 Adults $10 Students 21 and under

Race day - $45 Adults $15 Students 21 and under

1 Mile Walk Pricing
$10 Students 21 and under
March 1st - April 3rd - $15 Adults $10 Students 21 and under
Race day - $20 Adults $15 Students 21 and under

Please note, Strollers are permitted on the one-mile walk only.

race.name: 10K Test Race.
race.description: Test Race for RunScore

race.name: 10k Turkey Trek, 5k Turkey Trot & 2k Turkey Toddle
race.description:
This Arvada event supports Community Table, a local food bank! 

Join us on the Saturday BEFORE Thanksgiving as we race a 10k trek up the Ralston Creek Trail, starting from Long Lake Ranch Regional Park.

This is a trek worth bragging rights, as the hill at mile 2 is nothing to gobble at!

Not up for the whole trek?  Join the 2k Turkey Toddle or the 5k Turkey Trot with the "Fill Your Pie Hole" Challenge at the 1k mark!  (Although the 2k is untimed, the top 3 male and female finishers to cross the line will be recognized!)

10k Trekkers, 5k Trotters, and 2k Toddlers will receive a Trekker's Truckers Cap in 2019 in lieu of a race t-shirt.

address.street: Ralston Creek Trail @ Long Lake Ranch Park
